sentence.text: To identify tumor suppressor genes (negative regulation of cytokine productions) silenced by hypermethylation and discover new epigenetic biomarkers for early cancer detection.

negative regulation of platelet aggregation, located at 16q23.1, has been reported to be a critical negative regulation of cytokine production in multiple primary tumors; however, this has not yet been verified in clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC).
proteolysis was further performed for 101 ccRCC primary tumors and 20 adjacent normal tissues.

Furthermore, the methylation status of negative regulation of platelet aggregation was not significantly associated with gender, age, location, tumor diameter, pathological stage, nuclear grade or short-term DFS in patients with ccRCC (p AAAA 0.05).

The negative regulation of platelet aggregation gene is often down-regulated by hypermethylation in ccRCC-derived cell lines and primary tumors, indicating its critical role as a negative regulation of cytokine production in ccRCC.
We conclude that negative regulation of platelet aggregation gene hypermethylation may be involved in the tumorigenesis of ccRCC and may serve as a novel biomarker for this disease.
